}} 'Philadelphia Veterans Stadium' (informally called '"The Vet"') was a professional-
sports, multi-purpose stadium, located at the northeast corner of Broad Street
and Pattison Avenue, in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, as part of the South
Philadelphia Sports Complex. The listed seating capacities in 1971 were 62,000
seats for football, and 56,371 for baseball.

It housed the NFL's Philadelphia Eagles, from 1971 to 2002 and the National
League's Philadelphia Phillies baseball team, from 1971 to 2003. The 1976 and
1996 Major League Baseball All-Star Games were held at the venue. The Vet also
hosted the annual Army-Navy football game seventeen times: first in 1980, and
last in 2001.

In addition to professional baseball and football, the stadium hosted
other amateur and professional sports, large entertainment events and
other civic affairs.
